metadata.title: CVE-2014-3145 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The BPF_S_ANC_NLATTR_NEST extension implementation in the sk_run_filterfunction in net/core/filter.c in the Linux kernel through 3.14.3 uses thereverse order in a certain subtraction, which allows local users to cause adenial of service (over-read and system crash) via crafted BPFinstructions. NOTE: the affected code was moved to the__skb_get_nlattr_nest function before the vulnerability was announced.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3145` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-32-generic - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-3.13.0-32-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-3.13.0-32-lowlatency - 3.13.0-32.57

linux-image-3.13.0-32-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-3.13.0-32-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-32.57
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-32-generic - 3.13.0-32.57

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-32.57').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
